alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 8:36AM EST until December 19 at 7:25PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Missisquoi River At East Berkshire affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missisquoi River at East Berkshire. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Widespread flooding of low lying fields and some low lying roads will occur along the Missisquoi from Richford to Enosburg. Water will enter the yards of riverside homes in East Berkshire. At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding of low lying fields and roadways will occur from Richford to Enosburg. Water will approach Route 118 at East Berkshire, and Route 105 between Enosburg Falls and East Berkshire. Yards will be flooded in East Berkshire. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EST Tuesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 08/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EST.
